metadata.title: CVE-2022-49010 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:hwmon: (coretemp) Check for null before removing sysfs attrsIf coretemp_add_core() gets an error then pdata->core_data[indx]is already NULL and has been kfreed. Don't pass that tosysfs_remove_group() as that will crash in sysfs_remove_group().[Shortened for readability][91854.020159] sysfs: cannot create duplicate filename'/devices/platform/coretemp.0/hwmon/hwmon2/temp20_label'<cpu offline>[91855.126115] BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference, address:0000000000000188[91855.165103] #PF: supervisor read access in kernel mode[91855.194506] #PF: error_code(0x0000) - not-present page[91855.224445] PGD 0 P4D 0[91855.238508] Oops: 0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP PTI...[91855.342716] RIP: 0010:sysfs_remove_group+0xc/0x80...[91855.796571] Call Trace:[91855.810524]  coretemp_cpu_offline+0x12b/0x1dd [coretemp][91855.841738]  ? coretemp_cpu_online+0x180/0x180 [coretemp][91855.871107]  cpuhp_invoke_callback+0x105/0x4b0[91855.893432]  cpuhp_thread_fun+0x8e/0x150...Fix this by checking for NULL first.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-oracle - 4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
